content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of a Burner Inserter with drop position at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).  
Use-case: To extract items from the resource area and feed them into the transport network.

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x≈2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable Factory Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5)  
– New Factory Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT, which is associated with a neighbouring Burner Inserter at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and an Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5).  
Use-case: To serve as the interface for copper cable production by routing inputs from the chest to the processing machine.

### Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot  
– Adjacent Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5)  
– Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP, with a pickup position of (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop position of (x=3.5, y=13.5).  
Use-case: To act as an intermediate belt target connecting the extraction system with downstream processing.

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of:
– Offshore Pump at (x=-7.5, y=25.5)  
– Boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0)  
– Steam Engine (Generator) at (x=-0.5, y=24.5)  
Use-case: To generate power by converting water into steam for the production network.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
  – Error Message: “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target. You need to add an inserter that inputs items into Prototype.SteamEngine and use the inserter as the target entity.”  
  – Tip: Always verify that the target for belt connections is not a steam engine. Use an intermediary inserter to properly feed items into power-generating components.

• Wooden Chest Placement Errors  
  – Distance Error: “Could not place wooden-chest at (3.5, 15.5), The target position is too far away…”  
   Tip: Move closer to the target tile before attempting placement to stay within the maximum placement distance.  
  – Inventory Error: “No wooden_chest in inventory.”  
   Tip: Ensure the required item is available in inventory prior to executing the placement command.  
  – Variable Name Error: “NameError: name 'target_chest' is not defined…”  
   Tip: Use correct and defined variable names (e.g. target_pos or depot_chest) to avoid undefined variable errors.
